column1: 31186339;The Hunger Games;"The nation of Panem consists of a wealthy Capitol and twelve poorer districts. As punishment for a past rebellion
column2: each district must provide a boy and girl  between the ages of 12 and 18 selected by lottery  for the annual Hunger Games. The tributes must fight to the death in an arena; the sole survivor is rewarded with fame and wealth. In her first Reaping
column3: 12-year-old Primrose Everdeen is chosen from District 12. Her older sister Katniss volunteers to take her place. Peeta Mellark
column4: a baker's son who once gave Katniss bread when she was starving
column5: is the other District 12 tribute. Katniss and Peeta are taken to the Capitol
column6: accompanied by their frequently drunk mentor
column7: past victor Haymitch Abernathy. He warns them about the ""Career"" tributes who train intensively at special academies and almost always win. During a TV interview with Caesar Flickerman
column8: Peeta unexpectedly reveals his love for Katniss. She is outraged
column9: believing it to be a ploy to gain audience support
column10: as ""sponsors"" may provide in-Games gifts of food
column13: she discovers Peeta meant what he said. The televised Games begin with half of the tributes killed in the first few minutes; Katniss barely survives ignoring Haymitch's advice to run away from the melee over the tempting supplies and weapons strewn in front of a structure called the Cornucopia. Peeta forms an uneasy alliance with the four Careers. They later find Katniss and corner her up a tree. Rue
column15: draws her attention to a poisonous tracker jacker nest hanging from a branch. Katniss drops it on her sleeping besiegers. They all scatter
column17: who is killed by the insects. Hallucinating due to tracker jacker venom
column18: Katniss is warned to run away by Peeta. Rue cares for Katniss for a couple of days until she recovers. Meanwhile
column19: the alliance has gathered all the supplies into a pile. Katniss has Rue draw them off
column20: then destroys the stockpile by setting off the mines planted around it. Furious
column21: Cato kills the boy assigned to guard it. As Katniss runs from the scene
column22: she hears Rue calling her name. She finds Rue trapped and releases her. Marvel
column26: causing it to stab Rue in the stomach instead. Katniss shoots him dead with an arrow. She then comforts the dying Rue with a song. Afterward
column27: she gathers and arranges flowers around Rue's body. When this is televised
column28: it sparks a riot in Rue's District 11. President Snow summons Seneca Crane
column30: to express his displeasure at the way the Games are turning out. Since Katniss and Peeta have been presented to the public as ""star-crossed lovers""
column31: Haymitch is able to convince Crane to make a rule change to avoid inciting further riots. It is announced that tributes from the same district can win as a pair. Upon hearing this
column32: Katniss searches for Peeta and finds him with an infected sword wound in the leg. She portrays herself as deeply in love with him and gains a sponsor's gift of soup. An announcer proclaims a feast
column33: where the thing each survivor needs most will be provided. Peeta begs her not to risk getting him medicine. Katniss promises not to go
column35: she heads to the feast. Clove ambushes her and pins her down. As Clove gloats
column38: kills Clove after overhearing her tormenting Katniss about killing Rue. He spares Katniss ""just this time...for Rue"". The medicine works
column41: dies from eating nightlock berries she stole from Peeta; neither knew they are highly poisonous. Crane changes the time of day in the arena to late at night and unleashes a pack of hound-like creatures to speed things up. They kill Thresh and force Katniss and Peeta to flee to the roof of the Cornucopia
column42: where they encounter Cato. After a battle
column43: Katniss wounds Cato with an arrow and Peeta hurls him to the creatures below. Katniss shoots Cato to spare him a prolonged death. With Peeta and Katniss apparently victorious
column44: the rule change allowing two winners is suddenly revoked. Peeta tells Katniss to shoot him. Instead
column45: she gives him half of the nightlock. However
column47: they are hastily proclaimed the victors of the 74th Hunger Games. Haymitch warns Katniss that she has made powerful enemies after her display of defiance. She and Peeta return to District 12
column48: while Crane is locked in a room with a bowl of nightlock berries
column49: and President Snow considers the situation."

column1: 20663735;Narasimham;Poovalli Induchoodan  is sentenced for six years prison life for murdering his classmate. Induchoodan
column2: the only son of Justice Maranchery Karunakara Menon  was framed in the case by Manapally Madhavan Nambiar  and his crony DYSP Sankaranarayanan  to take revenge on idealist judge Menon who had earlier given jail sentence to Manapally in a corruption case. Induchoodan
column3: who had achieved top rank in Indian Civil Service loses the post and Manapally Sudheeran ([[Saikumar  enters the list of civil service trainees. We learn in flashback that it was Ramakrishnan  the son of Moopil Nair
column4: who had actually killed his classmate. Six years passes by and Manapally Madhavan Nambiar
column7: who is all rage at the gross injustice meted out to him - thus destroying his promising life
column8: is released from prison. Induchoodan thwarts Manapally Pavithran  from performing the funeral rituals of Nambiar at Bharathapuzha. Many confrontations between Induchoodan and Manapally's henchmen follow. Induchoodan also falls in love with Anuradha ([[Aishwarya
column9: the strong-willed and independent-minded daughter of Mooppil Nair. Justice Menon and his wife returns back to Kerala to stay with Induchoodan. There is an appearance of a girl named Indulekha ([[Kanaka
column10: who claims to be the daughter of Justice Menon. Menon flatly refuses the claim and banishes her. Forced by circumstances and at the instigation and help of Manapally Pavithran
column11: she reluctantly come out open with the claim. Induchoodan at first thrashes the protesters. But upon knowing the truth from Chandrabhanu his uncle
column12: he accepts the task of her protection in the capacity as elder brother. Induchoodan decides to marry off Indulekha to his good friend Jayakrishnan . Induchoodan has a confrontation with his father and prods him to accept mistake and acknowledge the parentage of Indulekha. Menon ultimately regrets and goes on to confess to his daughter. The very next day
column14: Indulekha is found dead and Menon is accused of murdering her. The whole act was planned by Pavithran
column16: forces Raman Nair  to testify against Menon in court. In court
column18: a close friend of Induchoodan and a famous supreme court lawyer
column19: appears for Menon and manages to lay bare the murder plot and hidden intentions of other party . Menon is judged innocent of the crime by court. After confronting Pavithran and promising just retribution to the crime of killing Indulekha
column21: who now shows remorse for all his actions including not believing in the innocence of his son. But while speaking to Induchoodan
column22: Menon suffers a heart stroke and passes away. At Menon's funeral
column23: Manapally Pavithran arrives to poke fun at Induchoodan and he also tries to carry out the postponed last rituals of his own father. Induchoodan interrupts the ritual and avenges for the death of his sister and father by severely injuring Pavithran. On his way back to peaceful life
column24: Induchoodan accepts Anuradha as his life partner.

column1: 2231378;The Lemon Drop Kid;"The Lemon Drop Kid
column3: is illegally touting horses at a Florida racetrack. After several successful hustles
column4: the Kid comes across a beautiful
column6: woman intending to bet a lot of money. The Kid convinces her to switch her bet
column7: employing a prefabricated con. Unfortunately for the Kid
column8: the woman ""belongs"" to notorious gangster Moose Moran
column9: as does the money. The Kid's choice finishes dead last and a furious Moran demands the Kid provide him with $10
column11: or the Kid ""won't make it to New Year's."" The Kid decides to return to New York to try to come up with the money. He first tries his on-again
column13: when talk of long-term commitment arises
column14: the Kid quickly makes an escape. He next visits local crime boss ""Oxford"" Charley
column15: with whom he has had past dealings. This falls through as Charley is in serious tax trouble and does not particularly care for the Kid anyway. As he leaves Charley's establishment and is about to give up hope
column16: the Kid notices a cornerside Santa Claus and his kettle. Thinking quickly
column17: the Kid fashions himself a Santa suit and begins collecting donations. This fails as he is recognized by a passing policeman
column18: who remembers his previous underhanded activity well. The Kid lands in court
column19: where he is convicted of collecting for a charity without a license and sentenced to ten days in jail . However
column21: the Kid learns where his scheme went wrong. After a short stay
column22: Brainy arrives to bail him out. He then sets about restarting his Santa operation
column23: this time with legitimate backing. To this end
column24: he needs a charity to represent and a city license. The kid receives key inspiration when he remembers that Nellie Thursday
column26: has been denied entry to a retirement home because of her jailed husband's criminal past as a safecracker. Organizing other small-time New York swindlers and Brainy
column27: who is both surprised and charmed at the Kid's apparent goodwill
column28: the Kid converts an abandoned casino  into the ""Nellie Thursday Home For Old Dolls"". A small group of elderly women and makeshift amenities complete the project. The Kid is able to receive the all-important city license. Now free to collect
column29: the Kid and his compatriots dress as Santa Claus and position themselves throughout Manhattan. The others are unaware that the Kid plans to keep the money for himself to pay off Moran. The scheme is a huge success
column31: 000 in only a few days. An overjoyed Brainy decides to leave her job as a dancer and look after the ""home"" full-time until after Christmas. Coincidentally
column32: her employer is none other than ""Oxford"" Charley
column33: whom Brainy cheerfully informs of the effort. Seeing a potential gold mine
column34: Charley decides to muscle in on the operation. Reasoning that the Nellie Thursday home is ""wherever Nellie Thursday is""
column35: Charley and his crew kidnap the home's inhabitants  and move them to Charley's mansion in Nyack. The Kid learns of this when he returns to the home after a late night to find the home deserted and money  gone. Clued in by oversized Oxford footprints in the snow
column36: the Kid and his friends pay Charley a visit. Here
column37: Charley reveals the true nature of the Kid's scheme through a phone conversation with Moose Moran. The Kid's accomplices are angry and move to confront him
column38: but the Kid manages to slip away. However
column39: Brainy tracks him down outside and voices her disgust at his actions. After a few days of stewing in self-pity
column40: the Kid is surprised to meet Nellie
column41: who has escaped Charley's compound. He decides to recover the money
column42: sneaking into Charley's home in the guise of an elderly woman. He finds that Charley and his crew are again moving the women
column43: this time to a more secure location. Using the heightened activity to his advantage
column44: the Kid enters Charley's office and confronts him. After a brief struggle
column45: the Kid overpowers Charley and makes off with the money
column46: narrowly avoiding the thugs Charley has sent after him. The ensuing chaos allows Brainy and the others to escape. Later that night
column47: the Kid returns to the original Nellie Thursday home to meet with Moose Moran . The deal appears to be in jeopardy as Moran arrives with Charley. Charley demands that the Kid reimburse him
column48: which would leave too little for Moran. However
column49: the Kid turns the tables by hitting a switch
column50: revealing hidden casino tables. All are occupied
column51: mainly by the escaped old dolls. The Kid and his still-loyal friends hold off the gangsters as the police initiate a raid. Moran and Charley are arrested while the judge who sentenced the Kid earlier warns that he will be ""keeping an eye on him"". The Kid assures him that will not be necessary and his attention will lie on the home
column52: which is going to become a reality. The night's main event begins as Nellie's husband Henry

column1: 595909;A Cry in the Dark;"Seventh-day Adventist Church pastor Michael Chamberlain
column4: and their nine-week-old daughter Azaria are on a camping holiday in the Outback. With the baby sleeping in their tent
column5: the family is enjoying a barbecue with their fellow campers when a cry is heard. Lindy returns to the tent to check on Azaria and is certain she sees a dingo with something in its mouth running off as she approaches. When she discovers the infant is missing
column6: everyone joins forces to search for her
column7: without success. It is assumed what Lindy saw was the animal carrying off the child
column8: and a subsequent inquest rules her account of events is true. The tide of public opinion soon turns against the Chamberlains. For many
column11: and too accepting of the disaster that has befallen her. Gossip about her begins to swell and soon is accepted as statements of fact. The couple's beliefs are not widely practised in the country
column12: and when the media report a rumour that the name Azaria means ""sacrifice in the wilderness""
column13: the public is quick to believe they decapitated their baby with a pair of scissors as part of a bizarre religious rite. Law-enforcement officials find new witnesses
column15: and a lot of circumstantial evidence—including a small wooden coffin Michael uses as a receptacle for his parishioners' packs of un-smoked cigarettes—and reopen the investigation
column16: and eventually Lindy is charged with murder. Seven months pregnant
column17: she ignores her attorneys' advice to play on the jury's sympathy and appears emotionless on the stand
column18: convincing onlookers she is guilty of the crime of which she is accused. As the trial progresses
column19: Michael's faith in his religion and his belief in his wife disintegrate
column20: and he stumbles through his testimony
column21: suggesting he is concealing the truth. In October 1982
column22: Lindy is found guilty and sentenced to life imprisonment with hard labour
column23: while Michael is found guilty as an accessory and given an 18-month suspended sentence. More than three years later
column24: while searching for the body of an English tourist who fell from Uluru
column25: police discover a small item of clothing that is identified as the jacket Lindy had insisted Azaria was wearing over her jumpsuit
column26: which had been recovered early in the investigation. She is immediately released from prison
column27: the case reopened and all convictions against the Chamberlains overturned."

column1: 5272176;End Game;The president is on his way to give a speech. While he is traveling there a man shows up with a camera. A reporter tries to ask a member of the secret service a question. When the president enters he is shot by the man with the camera. The president's main bodyguard
column3: is grazed by the bullet that hits the president. The shooter is gunned down by Alex and other secret service agents. The president dies at the hospital. Kate Crawford
column5: starts asking questions about the assassination. Anyone she questions is killed. She goes to Alex Thomas's house to tell him what is happening. As they head to his boat
column6: Thomas sees some men hiding in the bushes. He throws Kate into the water and dives in. Thomas jumps out of the water to kill two of the hitmen while a third hitman drives off to inform his boss what happened. They are able to link the hitmen to a man called Jack Baldwin . Agent Thomas and other Secret Service members attack the location of Jack Baldwin. Baldwin escapes but is later caught by Thomas. Thomas and Crawford are suspicious of Vaughan Stevens
column8: who had previous links opens to Baldwin. While reviewing film of the assassination at his house
column9: Thomas discovers that Stevens handed the assassin a gun during the president's entrance. Thomas leaves to find Stevens while Kate stays at his house. When Thomas arrives at Stevens' home he finds him dead. Before entering
column10: Thomas sees a car leaving the house. He then receives a call that Baldwin has escaped. Kate is attacked by Baldwin but Thomas arrives and kills Baldwin. Thomas arrives at the first lady's  home to see the car that left Steven's house pulling away. Thomas discovers that the first lady wanted her husband killed - due to the fact that the President was being unfaithful to her. A few weeks later Kate and Thomas have dinner. Thomas says that he still doesn't know who wanted the President dead.

column3: as she is completing her senior year of high school. Her small neighborhood in Brooklyn is falling apart and SING! is one of the only traditions keeping the neighborhood alive. Newly arrived teacher
column4: Miss Lombardo grew up in the neighborhood but returned to be their Sing Leader. One cold Christmas night
column5: Miss Lombardo is leaving a neighborhood party when a young man hails her a cab
column6: then attempts to mug her. In self defense
column7: she bites his hand to release his grip and he screams in pain and terror
column8: quickly making an exit. The cab driver jokes about not starting the meter yet. On the first day of school
column9: Miss Lombardo runs into difficulty when her students are uninterested and misbehaved. One such student was named Dominic who gets scolded for bringing stolen watches to school grounds and putting his feet up on the desk. On the day of Sing Leader elections
column10: Miss Lombardo recognizes Dominic as her mugger by the bandage on his hand and decides to blackmail him into being co-Sing Leader of the Senior class along with Hannah
column11: who was rightfully elected. The school kids work hard to plan their Sing productions. Hannah and Dominic clash along the way as Hannah uses traditional Sing planning strategies while Dominic wants to introduce the flavor of the youth in the neighborhood. In order to put Dominic and Hannah on the same page
column12: Miss Lombardo suggests that Hannah accompany Dominic to a local club. At first
column13: the two are equally hesitant but Hannah agrees on the terms that it is not a date. However
column14: by the end of the night
column15: Hannah uses Dominic to make her ex boyfriend
column19: Hannah and Dominic start seeing each other in a different light. Dominic accompanies Hannah on her walk home and the two share a romantic kiss. Once the two are finally uniting and getting along
column20: the Dept. of Education informs the school that it will close its doors forever at the end of this semester and therefore
column21: there will not be enough resources for them to complete this year's Sing. This fuels the kids to work even harder on their productions and the neighborhood comes together even more to help finance the show
column22: despite the school authorities' ban. Ironically
column23: just as things are starting to look up
column24: Dominic reluctantly accompanies his brother on a robbery of Hannah's mother's diner
column25: their sole source of income which already was at risk of failure due to the school's upcoming closure. A classmate saw Dominic standing outside the diner at the time of the crime and informed Hannah of what he saw. Devastated
column26: Hannah confronts Dominic and he promises to get the money back for her. He then steals the money back from his brother and returns it to the diner
column27: restoring Hannah's faith in him. The recent events had discouraged Dominic from fulfilling his co-Sing leader duties and he had been skipping out on rehearsals. In a moment of great need as the senior's main performer falls unconscious
column28: Dominic steps in to save the show. He sheds his bad-boy demeanor and exceeds all expectations. The underclassmen and seniors perform to a record-high sold out audience. At the end of the show
column29: Hannah makes a moving speech motivating the community to rejoice and always remember that despite compromising circumstances
column30: they completed a successful Sing and proved their community's worth.

column1: 2462689;Meet John Doe;"Infuriated at being told to write one final column after being laid off from her newspaper job
column2: Ann Mitchell  prints a letter from a fictional unemployed ""John Doe"" threatening suicide on Christmas Eve in protest of society's ills. When the note causes a sensation and the paper's competition suspects a fraud and starts to investigate
column3: the newspaper editor rehires Mitchell who comes up with a scheme of hiding the fictional nature of ""John Doe"" while exploiting the sensation caused by the fake letter to boost the newspaper's sales
column4: for which she demands a bonus equal to 8 months' pay. After reviewing a number of derelicts who have shown up at the paper claiming to have penned the original suicide letter
column5: Mitchell and editor Henry Connell  hire John Willoughby
column6: a former baseball player and tramp who is in need of money to repair his injured arm
column7: to play John Doe. Mitchell now starts to pen an article series in Doe's name
column8: elaborating on the letter's ideas of society's disregard of people in need. Willoughby gets $50
column10: and a plush hotel suite with his tramp friend
column11: who launches into an extended diatribe against ""the heelots""
column12: lots of heels who incessantly focus on getting money from others. Willoughby is hired to give radio speeches
column13: guided by Mitchell who is promised $100 a week to write his speeches
column15: D.B. Norton ([[Edward Arnold . Willoughby turns down a $5
column16: 000 bribe to admit the whole thing was a publicity stunt
column18: and dashes off to the countryside with ""The Colonel"". They ride the rails
column19: playing the harmonica and ocarina until they show up in Millsville
column20: where John Doe is recognized at a diner. He's brought to City Hall
column22: who gives a five-minute monologue about how he was inspired to start a local John Doe club. The John Doe philosophy spreads across the country
column23: developing into a broad grassroots movement whose simple slogan is
column24: ""Be a better neighbor"". Far from being an altruistic philanthropist
column26: Norton plans to channel the support for Doe into support for his own national political ambitions. As a culmination of this plan
column27: Norton has instructed Mitchell to write a speech for Willoughby in which he announces the foundation of a new political party and endorses Norton as its presidential candidate. When Willoughby
column28: who has come to believe in the John Doe philosophy himself
column29: realizes that he is being used
column30: he tries to expose the plot
column31: but is first stymied in his attempts to talk his own mind to a nationwide radio audience at the rally instead of reading the prepared speech
column32: and then exposed as a fake by Norton
column33: who claims to have been deceived
column35: by the staff of the newspaper. Frustrated by his failure
column36: Willoughby intends to commit suicide by jumping from the roof of the City Hall on Christmas Eve
column37: as indicated in the original John Doe letter. Only the intervention of Mitchell and followers of the John Doe clubs persuades him to renege on his threat to kill himself. At this point in the movie
column38: a reference to Jesus Christ is made
column39: that a historical ""John Doe"" has already died for the sake of humanity. The film ends with Connell turning to Norton and saying
column41: Norton! The people! Try and lick that!"""
